description: Contraction of cup of (with “tea” or sometimes “coffee” implied). See also a (“of”), pinta (“pint of milk”).

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, colloquial) A cup of tea (or sometimes any hot drink).
examples: I’ve just put the kettle on – fancy a cuppa?

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, colloquial) Whatever interests or suits one; one's cup of tea.
examples: Similes were not my cuppa, anyway. My classmates tended to overload their writing with them (all-time record: six in one paragraph) and they stuck out like violins in a rock tune.
And he orders a cuppa cawfee. “A cuppa cawfee and what else?” I says to him.
